website_summaries.verdict: With not one but three levels of track, each with its own ball, your cat will spend hours trying to catch the elusive prey.
pros: Heavy-duty toy stands up to rough play
Nonskid pads on the bottom hold the toy in place while your cat swats at it
cons: None to speak of, but your cat might eventually tire of it

customer_reviews.title: Four paws up!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love ball in track toys, and this is their new favorite with three tiers they can access horizontally. Other reviews mention a safety problem but it has been corrected with a bar across the top of this version. It measures 10" diameter at the bottom (same as inside cardboard scratcher circle of turbo scratcher) and 5-1/4" tall. It is lightweight but has 4 small rubber feet to keep it from sliding. It didn't tip or move with 4 adult cats playing with it. Not much more for me to say but I'll let the kitties show you themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Mausita

customer_reviews.title: Great cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Great cat toy, my 20 pound, 13 year old main coon who bats my size 13 shoes around when he feels like playing loves it! It has rubber feet on the bottom which keep it from going flying everytime he touches it, it does move around a bit however he has yet to flip it over. It is the new style with the bar across the top.
customer_reviews.author: Chestertheamazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 16 years young, and with the passing of his brothers, I wanted to make sure he stays active while I'm at work. He loves the laser pointer and his toys on a stick but the Tower of Tracks keeps him engaged while I'm away. Now if he would quit playing with it at 2 am. LOL. But, seriously a great toy to keep an old guy happy!
customer_reviews.author: Just Pat

customer_reviews.title: Improved - safety strip added to top
customer_reviews.text: My kitties like this toy, one in particular. It is quite a bit smaller than the regular track ball toy. I've included a couple of pictures so you can see the difference in size. Also, more important, they have added a strip of plastic to the top of this toy so there will not be any further problems with kitties getting their heads stuck in the center! I substituted the balls with Cat-It Senses motion activated illuminated balls to make it more interesting for the kitties. They come in a package of 2, so you'll need 2 packs, or just substitute 2 of the 3.
customer_reviews.author: C. K. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Ignored. Even with additional light-up balls
customer_reviews.text: All four cats ignored it despite buying additional "light-up" motion sensitive balls per another reviewer's recommendation. The blue paint on the edging started chipping immediately (wondered about the chemical composition). Note: cats are also not interested in the light-up balls and you can buy rainbow colored foam practice golf balls in bulk quite cheaply. However. It is quite pretty.
customer_reviews.author: wellson

customer_reviews.title: Not for older cats
customer_reviews.text: Cats would not touch it. Tried several times. Maybe kittens would like it. My cats play with their toy mice all the time so I thought they would like this. See my photo? That's how it looked the entire time I had it. What's the problem? There are no cats anywhere. I ended up giving it to a lady that fosters kittens.
customer_reviews.author: teridene

customer_reviews.title: loved it at first
customer_reviews.text: This was a great toy that my cat loved at first. It kept her entertained for a long time. Both of the balls came out within a couple of days. The top ball I believe is supposed to come out. The bottom ball looked like it would stay in for a different level of play but it came out of the opening and got lost. If I could find a replacement size ball that would be great. The overall concept is great, with three levels of play to keep your cat entertained. The top ball is easily replaced but the bottom one, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: dkreutz3

customer_reviews.title: Her new favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this. I honestly was not expecting her to like it as much as she did. She started playing with it as soon as it came out of the box. There was no warm up period like there normally is with her new toys. I highly recommend this toy for cats. There's even a nifty little safety bar so she doesn't get her head stuck in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kittens love it! They play with it every day. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Sokolli

customer_reviews.title: This is reviewed by my cat (I liked it better than she did)
customer_reviews.text: I am 8 years old - I may have liked it if I got it when I was a kitten. I slapped the balls around a couple of times to appease my new mom. I wish she would stop bringing in toys - she claims I am the first cat she has owned and it shows! This colorful toy will be donated to a kitten (I hope) Mom has slapped the balls around more times than I have so she may want to keep it for herself.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: BORRRRRRRRRING!
customer_reviews.text: My cats aren't overly thrilled as I thought they might be. One swat and they walk away. Cute presentation, but for my 2 cats who are real players, I was utterly surprised that hardly 1 minute spent with this tower and that was it for a frisky 8 month old cat and a 9 yr old one also frisky who are normally up and ready to play from AM to PM. Disappointed over all.
customer_reviews.author: FRENCHFROG777

customer_reviews.title: Yepper - it works!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Well made. Keeps the kitten engaged. Balls 'stay' in the form and keep moving freely. Design recommendation, or after-purchase, might be balls that fit w/ bells or sparkling things inside them, to see if mixing up the media would excite kitten after he's played w/ this for a while and become a little less interested. Ordered some more, to see if will fit. O, and a catnip ball might also be a fun after-sell. Update: Posting pic to show opening at top. Doubt head could get through, if of concern. Still engaging to kitten. And other balls fit easily.
customer_reviews.author: Melody P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My cats’ favorite toy, even with one ball missing
customer_reviews.text: I have two adolescent kittens who will play with anything. But this is, by far, their favorite toy of all. They play with it endlessly. In fact, I often find it dragged off to some other part of the house. Unfortunately, my kitties quickly removed the bottom ball, so now only two are left to circle around the track. That, and the fact that I wish it were more weighted so it stayed in place, caused me to rate this a 4 instead of a 5. But, even with two balls instead of three, it remains my cats’ favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: JBWW

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Fine for kittens but too small for regular sized cats. Balls are too lightweight. My cat likes a similar toy a lot better. Pretty much turns her nose up at this one.
customer_reviews.author: DarkStoneCastle

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat attractive, but marginally designed.
customer_reviews.text: This product has attractive colors with three concentric rings of diminishing radius as it rises from the base; The upper level contains a ball that is attractive to our cat and rolls easily when tapped. Our cat LOVES this. The two lower rings contain differently designed balls which are NOT so colorful -- and which NEITHER roll as easily nor as long. Cat is mostly interested in only the upper ring. Lower two rings OR balls need improvement.
customer_reviews.author: dickb

customer_reviews.title: My cat plays with this toy
customer_reviews.text: The important thing here is that my cat actually plays with this toy consistently. Another one that I tried that was similar was a total lose. I think the aroma of catnip from the hanging toy helps, although my cat does not play with that particular feature. He loves to bat the lower ball around and around. My granddaughter managed to pry the upper solid yellow ball off and lose it, but the cat still plays with the other ball. I even hear him in the middle of the night, batting the thing around. We have it on the living room carpet, and it travels about a foot every time he plays with it. Not a big deal for us.
customer_reviews.author: suzbuz1st

customer_reviews.title: Hope orange plastic fit your decor but you will not care at this point because you are reading this review already...
customer_reviews.text: An instant hit in the house! My two highly energetic kittens love the toy from the moment I unpack the it. I was thinking to get the other similar cat chase toy by Bergen with a scratching pad, which I believe that was being discontinued. Settled for this one at last and it maybe a better idea! good toy for multiple cats household as it has three tiers. A relief to know that the kittens can occupy themselves when nobody is home as this is neither powered by batteries or human slaves. If only they stop attacking and my bathtub drainer when I am gone! Eww dudes! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy S.

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy ever!!! 2 in1 toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten LOVES this toy!!!! And he is so very hard to please! He is two months old and gets bored quickly. He will always go back to this one. ALSO, you can remove the balls and he has fun knocking it all around the room!! I added a video and took the video after 2 minutes of playing with this toy. Now for all you cat owners, you know that is a very long time for a kitten to play with one toy. In my opinion..this is the best cat toy ever!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendalinaaa

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It's much much better than the "Catnip Chase" toy by same company. Never buy that one- it's awful and tiny. This one is large enough for average adult cat to play with without tipping over. The mouse toy is not springy but very stiff. Wish it would bend over and spring back when my cat pulls on it. The 2 balls are a nice variation on a ball chase. I still wish it was more weighted as my big boy ends up pushing this instead of playing with it. I would not buy again. The turbo ball chase is still the best.
customer_reviews.author: Lh

customer_reviews.title: Bought because of good reviews but my cat hasnt touched this
customer_reviews.text: This was at the top of cat toys based on reviews and naturally thought I had to have it for my short haired black tuxedo cat Daphne whose 3 and very playful. She LOVES her spin around mouse but hasn’t touched this ONCE even with my encouragement and spinning of the balls myself. Very dissapointed, going to have to throw out or give to goodwill unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: LolaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cat's love it, kids might ruin it!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the cats! They really enjoy spinning those balls around! I have 2 cats, one doesn't care for the toy much and prefers lasers and my second cat loves to play with this every day. However, if you have kids, keep in mind they might pull the balls out of the compartment and loose them. I am giving this just 4 stars as we have lost a ball and there are not replacement balls available to order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended - so poorly designed Cats cannot play with it.
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. Item is very poorly designed. The base is so narrow, compared to its height, that both of my cats knock it upside down with minimal effort. It is also so lightweight that if one of my cats bats at a ball it sends the toy across the room. This was a cool idea - executed very very poorly. The manufacturer needs to redo it with a wider base diameter and make it substantial enough that it stays in one spot when cats play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Brown

customer_reviews.title: They both love it EVENTUALLY
customer_reviews.text: I wish this were 4-5 inches taller for older/larger cats. We adopted a bonded pair and this was in their cage, so we bought one for them. One cat plated with it CONSTANTLY. He never tired of it. My cats now noticed it only after a few months. They love playing with it when it strikes their fancy but it could have an extra level or two for older/ taller cats. The balls have never 'escaped' and there is a protective crossbar on the toy now. Cats require patience and have 'moods'. Some toys are loved then ignored for a long time before being noticed again.
customer_reviews.author: M'ette

customer_reviews.title: Right Out The Box!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took this toy out the box my cats started playing with it right away. It's 9:30PM and they're still taking turns playing with it! I'm so glad I brought this. They were becoming bored and just laying around depressed looking. We've added so many restrictions and closed off areas they're not allowed to go in. I recently rescued these two. They were badly abused and starving. Look at them now... It's a joy seeing them playing and do happy. Just a simple toy made a difference. No assembly or batteries needed.
customer_reviews.author: RainSings

customer_reviews.title: She love's her new Lay N’ Play Track!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat took to this toy right from the start. She would lay next to it or on top to push the ball around the oval track. It rolled so smoothly that after she pushed it she would watch it rotate a few times on it's own before pouncing on it. We had a problem with the ball popping out but quickly found that the top cover was not securely connected to the base. Two things we found that fixed this problem was that the the latches from the top cover were not completely latched to the base and that we also pushed all around the top cover to close any gaps between the top cover and the base.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I received this toy this afternoon, I was impressed at first. But after removing the packaging, searching the box it came in as well as the box it was packed in. I discovered that the ball it was suppose to come with was missing. This toy was meant for my mother’s extremely active cat was missing. It was not in either boxes. I was very disappointed as well as my mother. I will be returning this toy and trying to find something close to it. Be careful when you order this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jenae Gagne

customer_reviews.title: My kitten’s favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my kitten’s favorite toy. She loves laying beside it and watching the balls go. She was once so energetic that she flipped it over! In the video, there is a laser toy sitting on top of the Cat Tracks toy. It is not part of Cat Tracks. This Cat Tracks has the safety bar across the top. Should something happen to this toy, I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Jack Pladdys, MDiv

customer_reviews.title: It isn’t made like it used to be - no longer recommend this
customer_reviews.text: I have bought at least ten of these in the past years for gifts or my own cats. They have changed the design on these and now the balls are very light and hard to move! Frustrating! I used to be able to spin the entire toy and get the balls rolling madly, but not anymore the balls are too lightweight. I hate when they change a previously loved toy to make it less quality! Now I wish I didn’t give so many away! Grrrrr!!
customer_reviews.author: Carpe Diem

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cat track toys around BUT with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats absolutely enjoys this track/bed to death. The other one is more meh about it. The bed is indeed interchangeable but we settled on the taffeta side. The only issue with the toy is that our cats become so overzealous with it that they pull the ball out of the track. I almost feel that they are passive-aggressively doing that so we can play with it [vicariously] but it is nevertheless annoying. Popping the ball back into the track is no problem--finding it is a word that I won't repeat in good company. If you have strong and/or uppity cats, BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Chand

customer_reviews.title: Lucy Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my friend's cat. Don't know much about cats (I am a dog person) but the guy on Animal Planet says cats need physical interaction/activity. Lucy doesn't get any of that. So, due to all the great reviews and pictures from previous purchasers, Lucy now chases her balls round and round. Her owner is amazed that she plays with it multiple times daily. It is now a part of Lucy's night time routine. Thank you, everyone, for your help in making my gift selection and for adding excitement and pleasure to Lucy's life.
customer_reviews.author: Fancy Dancer

customer_reviews.title: My cat wanted nothing to do with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality toy (although the color options are garish), however my cat wanted absolutely nothing to do with it. He's a large, 2 year old, playful, slightly diva-ish Ragdoll and he was very unimpressed. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J L Florida

customer_reviews.title: Our cat’s new best friend!
customer_reviews.text: Things to love: (1) It’s not noisy, (2) it keeps our cat occupied and entertained, (3) it’s light weight and (4) requires no assembling. Things that aren’t so great: (1) Again, it’s super light weight- meaning, our cat also pushes it around constantly as he attacks it. But we’re going add some anti-slid strips/pads (the ones you normally use on furniture) to it to see if that helps! All in all, we recommend! We got it over Black Friday weekend, and it went down to about $5/6... Totally worth it! And what. Good price- at Petland they retail for about $20. Grab it on here instead!
customer_reviews.author: Alex & Kesia

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived fun.
customer_reviews.text: This toy was a major hit for 24 hours. We have 4 cats; 2 kittens, 2 adults. They were fascinated with it. They analyzed it. They played non-stop. Then it was totally uninteresting. Only the top ball had any real intrigue. The lower balls required the cats to be lying down to play. Why pay $7.61 (what I payed), for 24 hours of fun? Nope, I will continue to use Da Bird, and rattle mice. Much better purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W. Mcclure

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, balls stay secure, good for even the laziest cats
customer_reviews.text: My lazy-butt cat doesn’t play w anything especially if I’m around (playing is top-secret cat business). The video shows me introducing it to her while she was half-asleep lol Now I’ve even caught her playing with it right in front of me (she thought I couldn’t see bc it was dark). Also, it’s very quiet. She was going ham on it and I was worried it would wake my light-sleeper bf up, but he didn’t even hear it. I recommended it to my sister and her rambunctious cat loves the dang thing and she appreciates the quietness.
customer_reviews.author: Chasepants

customer_reviews.title: He likes it!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I was impressed with how quickly this shipped. However, the most impressive thing is that my cat, Severus, starting playing with it almost the moment I pulled it from the box. I've been working from home and being meowed at to play with him for hours, while trying to get work done. He won't play with his toy mice, except one that dangles and I have to hold the rod and move it for him. He likes the laser pointer, but the one that I have hold and aim. It was wonderful to have him contentedly playing on his own while I got work done.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Wills

customer_reviews.title: Our cats LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: Our cats are VERY energetic and are often getting into trouble so we picked one of these up to help keep them busy during the day. They absolutely LOVE it. I swear they played with it for 3 hours straight when we first got it. I honestly thought they'd get bored of it pretty quick, but they've been playing with it every day since. It doesn't make a lot of noise or take up much space either and the best part is, they can both play together, which makes them play longer. It's nice to see how something so simple makes them so happy. ^_^
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Van Kampen

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy if you watch the  price
customer_reviews.text: This toy had a safety issue with the large opening (cat head size) at the top. It has been redesigned adding a bar across the opening. Other mfgrs have not addressed this issue, so be mindful. Kudos Petstages. Prices vary widely from day to day ($9-$20) but if you can grab it when they are cheap, go for it. I also have found that you can pop out the balls and replace them with either a Bergen Twinkle Ball or a Catit Fire Ball (has replaceable batteries). Cat LOVES the lighted balls (did top and bottom row only-all 3 was too much). Lighted balls also help add weigh to it.
customer_reviews.author: Rural gal

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer needs to improve this item
customer_reviews.text: The seller did fine. No issues there. But the manufacturer needs to offer clips that can adhere to the bottom of this toy so it can be dug down into a carpet to hold it in place. The cats do love this toy but once it's turned upside down, which happens every 2 minutes at least then it's not worth playing with and the cats leave it alone. They just walk away. Something needs to hold this down to the floor. Even if it's pieces of velcro which I will have to add to ours. It's a fun toy for the cats (we have 7 cats) but it's worthless if it turns over.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Weber

customer_reviews.title: He learned to play!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I use these for our fosters. I worked with an abused cat that didn't know how to play and it became his favorite toy! I tried all kinds of toys and lo and behold this one was it! He saw me take my fingers and move the balls around and he got it. He took his paws and would hit them back to me. Then when I got up and walked away he did this on his own! This is very durable and easy to clean! I will buy again and again as it is a great toy letting our cats be.... cats! You won't be sorry with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cat entertained for a long time
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this! She will play with it several times a day, usually for at least 15 minutes at a stretch. Sometimes she gets lazy and lays down to swat the balls around, but other times she stalks and pounces at it. My only complaint is that she gets so rambunctious that she's able to tip it over completely. I am thankful for the bar across the hole in the middle - my cat has tried to get the balls through the middle many times, so I know the bar has kept her from getting her head stuck. I am convinced this toy keeps her entertained if we're gone for long stretches of time.
customer_reviews.author: Tabi C.

customer_reviews.title: My mature cats often stare at any toy with disinterest ...
customer_reviews.text: My mature cats often stare at any toy with disinterest. This toy really got their attention and they return to it daily for play. Hopefully their enthusiasm will continue.
customer_reviews.author: Happily Retired

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: The best cat toy ever! She can’t lose it under furniture or break it. This beauty has allowed me to get better sleep at night because our cat will knock the balls around a little instead of waking me up! It was fun watching her learn how it works and it’s still fun watching her play with it now that she understands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even the shy kitty is in love with this toy
customer_reviews.text: I have recently adopted a 5 year old shy cat who prefers hiding over playing. I’ve gotten her those multiple toys package from amazon but she was still reluctant to play completely. Until I got her this. Granted it took her about a week to get acclimated with this toy. But once she did she won’t stop playing with it. Everyday and night she is fascinated by this toy. The toy is sturdy and well made. It does come with the bar that covers the hole. Shipping package was a bit on the flimsy side but the toy wasn’t damaged. It is worth every penny 10 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Darkeyes

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the cat entertained
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my kitten for Christmas. He played with it for the longest time. The balls roll around, and keep rolling as the cat bats at them. This is so funny to watch. I will say that the bar across the top of the hole is absolutely needed. My cat would have had his head in there several times without it. He kept putting his paws in the hole trying to reach the balls from the inside. :) The only issue we have is that it is somewhat easy to overturn. The balls are very secure and the unit as a whole is very solid. It might do better with a weighted bottom.
customer_reviews.author: J C Lee

customer_reviews.title: So good, I bought it twice!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy so much, I bought a second one for the other floor of the house. I received the new one today and she ran right to it and played with it off and on for much of the day. When we went to the other floor, she played with the original I bought - a good sign that she wasn't tired of it! Another bonus is the toy is kitty powered, so batteries or charging aren't necessary. It is hard to select a toy from all the options but I'm happy to tell you that this is her favorite and she's so cute playing with it that it amuses me too!
customer_reviews.author: _Beth_

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but cats lost a lot interest after about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Newness has worn off for our two cats. They play with it zero to three times in a week now. Collapsible prop on the underside that could open so that toy sets at about a 25 degree angle might add additional interest to the toy. With prop in place all balls would rest on one side and when hit by cats balls would eventually come to rest on one side of toy. Would have two options this way to use the prop or not and maybe that would keep cats interested longer. Quality of toy is good and it should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Geepop

customer_reviews.title: Kitten loves it, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten is very happy with this purchase. He has played with this every day since we got it. Simplistic but effective. Pros: kitten loves to play with this toy and having it helps focus his crazy outbursts appropriately. Con: the plastic is soft and the cat bites the edges while playing with it. Doesn't affect functionality at this time but can see it becoming an issue. Also note, while the balls stay in when the kitten plays with this toy, they seem to pop out easily when any human child comes in contact with it. We have lost a few. However, we have found ping pong balls work for affordable replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: FUN FOR MY CAT, FUN FOR ME TO WATCH HER PLAY WITH IT.
customer_reviews.text: Update of my review: Sadie still plays with this toy over a year since I first ordered it for her. Sometimes I will wake up in the middle of the night startled because I hear this odd noise. Come to find out it is Sadie batting the balls around in the dark. LOL. One person mentioned on this review that they put it up at night as their cat also tends to want to play with it in the middle of the night. I still get a kick out of watching her play with it.
customer_reviews.author: LynnWied

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My pets absolutely love it but within just one day one ball got out, another week and another ball is out! 2 our of 3 are gone!!!!!! Really???? I tried to put it back in but got out as soon as my pet started to play! I can’t recommend this product and it s a shame because my 2 cats couldn’t get enough of it
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good Toy For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this toy is worth it because it's better than buying all the little balls/toys that aren't attached to anything and just get lost. As soon as a toy goes under the couch where my cat can't reach, he loses interest and it's pretty much lost forever. I like this toy because the balls can't get lost, and my cat definitely seems entertained by it. I've only had it a few days and saw him going up to it and playing with it a few times now. For the price, this is definitely a good deal even if my cat gets bored with it, it was cheap enough.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: fun for kitten
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten loves this. I have a couple toys that have elastic bands holding tassles together, and I tied those around the handle at the top for some added fun. The tracks are a little tight (maybe bent a little in shipping?), so that balls don't spin around super easy, but he still enjoys it. I like that it is small and not very noisy. I keep it in the office so when he stops in during the day to say hello he plays with it for a bit and it isn't disturbing if I am on the phone for work.
customer_reviews.author: JPatten

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: i wanted to like this, but my cat can toss this around like a piece of paper, it is too light weight and flimsy. He is a large cat but he can play with it by picking it up with both his paws, not something he can do with a wider based toy. The grippers on the bottom, do not grip anything. I have 3 other cats who appear somewhat interested but not enough to warrant the purchase of this. Sorry but this one is a fail. Go for the wider based toy, it cant be tipped over unless you have a mountain lion. :(
customer_reviews.author: sally

customer_reviews.title: KITTY LIKE ROUND AND ROUND TOY
customer_reviews.text: The shelter which I adopted my kitten from had this toy, so I bought one for home. My kitten loves it, she will bap at the balls to watch them go round and round. She will even try to pull them out of the toy, but they stay in the toy tracks. She even goes on her back and reaches up to play with the ball and it is so cute she has such a furry belly and it is so soft she is so cute and loves her toy Thank god it doesn't fall easily, with the way she pulls on it, it could easily fall over onto her head. Not that it would matter, it's a light toy.
customer_reviews.author: Elysa

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my cat EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this toy for my cat. It arrived quickly with amazon prime 2 day shipping. From the first moment I showed my cat how this toy "worked", she's been hooked!!! She loves everything about it and plays constantly. It's such a joy watching her come to life when the balls start rolling. She goes crazy! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: DLH-PA

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for everyone
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this toy design because her two kittens found it entrancing. I wasn't sure how it would work with our adult cat, but decided to give it a try. Wow, she loves it! We have to put it away at night or she would keep playing with it. So far, and it has been over a week, she doesn't tire of playing with it. During this time of increased being inside, it's great to have a toy that entertains both us and our cat.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, well made, cat is "meh".
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find large balls with bells in them so I thought this would work for him. The ball can not go anywhere but he can catch it in the apparatus. Well, not knowing what your cat is really into , buying these things tells us what satisfies and not. He is not so much into this. I guess he likes to chase the bell rather than trap it. It didnt break the bank but I have a toy that he most likely will not play with. The toy itself is great. Maybe it's more for kittens than 2 year old cats.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gurkan

customer_reviews.title: Good Price but Not a Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little toy for my cat in hopes it would entice her to play a little. The truth is, she is over 16 years old and seems to have decided playing is for much younger cats. The truth of this matter is this toy cost no more than shipping for the bed I purchased and its addition gave me free shipping. The toy itself is cute as a button and would be great entertainment for a young, playful cat. The balls are very lightweight and seem to be secure in the tracks. I believe it was a fair value for the price and would provide hours of fun for a much younger, more playful cat.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Bright

customer_reviews.title: Knock off product
customer_reviews.text: I received a knock off item. Buyer beware. This item did not have the safety bar. Your cat's head can get stuck in there. It arrived in a padded envelope without any other packaging materials. It's not by Petstages. The item arrived in two pieces and I had to snap them together. The tracks were not aligned and therefore the balls don't spin. Not safe for your cats.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fostering!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my fosters and it was an amazing investment. I'd say probably 3/4 of the foster cats and kittens have enjoyed the toy, and it gives them something to do when I can't spend time playing with them. It can take a bit for them to realize that it's a toy so I'll play with it next to them until they figure it out. Some go absolutely WILD, others just kind of bat at it or lazily lay down to play. The thing I love about it for fostering is that it's easy to clean. I sanitize everything to the best of my ability between fosters, so something all plastic is a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: SaltySpouses

customer_reviews.title: Our kittens love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted 2 kittens from the local shelter & boy are they in LOVE with this toy! As you can see in the video they’re enthralled with the balls going round & round. (My husband is flicking them so they’ll go around really fast) They play with this toy every morning! The littlest one loves to stand on the top & watch. You definitely won’t regret buying this! Note: we did find a similar toy at a big box store & it was more expensive & really flimsy! We’re glad we found this one.
customer_reviews.author: NMK9Mom

customer_reviews.title: My youngest cat loves this thing
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this thing. The vet said to get him some thinking toys. He gets so much energy out which I love. He’s over 2 now so not a kitten anymore but he has soooo much energy. It has the bar over the top so ignore the negative reviews, they fixed that problem a while back. A normal cat probably wouldn’t move this as much as he does but he’s a very strong and hyper. My other two cats don’t play with it but they are probably afraid to because he loves it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Missysjas

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it took about 30 seconds for our Siamese to pop the ball out of the track. She did have a lot of fun chasing it around the room, but that wasn't exactly the idea. Have replaced it several times, and she has gotten it out several times. Then our calico easily spun the top around to completely open the compartment where the catnip is. This has all been in the first hour. So far I am not so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sunbird

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cats after seeing it in store for $30. I didn't want to spend that much and was excited when I found it on Amazon for only $6. However this is definitely a cheaply made product and is not as nice as the one in store. The colors on the balls aren't as vibrant and the middle ball gets stuck and won't go all the way around. The balls are also extremely thin plastic. I could break one with my hand just by giving it a little squeeze. My cats like it, but I might have to go and buy the more expensive one in store if this one doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila Knies

customer_reviews.title: Ball Toy for Cats/Kittenx
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1 yr old cat named Bella. She wasnt fond of this toy at 1st. I'd sit there and hit the balls to see if she'd join in, but I think she was too skeptical at first. Eventually she went and played on her own. She finally sits there and smacks the ball a few times but then walks away. I wish the balls had a little bit more weight go help propel them and keep the momentum more. Its a great toy for any cat that loves to play. Mine is just strange with her toys haha, we are still figuring her out.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Best $8 you will spend on your kitty
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best $8 I ever spent! My 2 kittens play with this so much they finally get worn out and settle down! The only thing that would make it 100%perfect is if it were slightly heavier. I often come home to find it flipped upside down and they clearly don’t know how to flip it back. It’s easy enough for me to do, but I think they lose some play time when it gets “stuck” and I’m not home. But even if only 1 is playing with it, it’s entertaining for him. I don’t know whether it’s more fun for them or for me to watch them!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Higgins

customer_reviews.title: He loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is hard on toys but this definitely is up to whatever my boy does, rather what he’s done so far... He loves the bright colors and patterns on the balls. He’s absolutely incensed that the balls will not come out. If kittens could stomp, he’d be stomping. Hilarious to watch. He’s even flipped it thinking then he’d have a better angle to reach in and pull out the balls. Nope. Sorry... Definitely intellectual stimulation, keeps his interest, generally quiet when he plays with it at night, durable, and I’ve batted the balls around so he can go after them so it has the potential to be partially interactive play.
customer_reviews.author: K.Nejdl

customer_reviews.title: Cats and Kitten Love this toy
customer_reviews.text: Our Babies love this toy. Our Kitten, Frankie can't get enough of this toy. He constantly is moving the balls around the circles nonstop. Our 2 older cats watch him and then play with him. Its adorable to watch them play together. At times, our kitten will flip it over and try playing with it upside-down and get the balls going that way. Frankie is an interesting little kitten with this toy. He loves it. We are happy he has fun with it. Thanks for great toy. Our Toy has the oragnge safety bar across the round circle on top so no cats can get their head caught inside it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Krzyna-RaspetTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ball easily lost, ruining toy
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it, however they managed to lose the ball in 3 days. There are no replacement balls sold without a large price tag. I used the size if the ball to search for a new one and discovered that ping pong balls are very close. I'm awaiting their arrival to test it out. The rubber feet probably work well on a smooth floor, but on carpet they pushed that thing all over the place. Also if note is the odd star questions, thickness and suction power?
customer_reviews.author: David M. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT toy
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing. The kitten I bought this toy for saw the reflections on the inside and tried to get to the balls on the inside. Once he figured out that balls were on the outside were more fun, he spent most of the next 2 hours playing with the toy. He did take about two minutes to eat and go to the bathroom. The rest of the two hours were spent playing. I understand that he spent most of the night playing with the toy as well. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive and entertaining cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Our kittens love it! We change out the ball with different ones to keep them from getting bored. We even pop in a few at a time so they can knock them together and change the path the ball takes. We had a heavy ball that came out of an old computer tracker (mouse) and that rolls great inside of the track. We popped in a ball that opens to hold catnip and while it makes a mess, they love it (we just clean it up later) we bought a ball that lights up and they play in the dark with it too soooo what I'm saying is that it's versatile and entertaining and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, balls move smoothly, cats both loved it
customer_reviews.text: Our wicked smart black cat got a kick out of it. She got bored, of course. The other (gray, non-rocket-scientist) cat got even more excited while the black cat looked on, aloof (see video). We'll hide it away tomorrow and bring it back out again maybe once a week. Update 2020 Jan 29: Two weeks later and BOTH cats ADORE this toy, even our smart cat! We haven't had to hide it away yet - though we do move it around the house ("Hey, look! A NEW toy!")
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Kelley, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes it. It seems like good quality. My qualm with it, and this is the same reason I don’t use laser pointers with my cat, he seems to actually get kind of mad he can’t get the ball out of there. Yes it keeps him entertained but I think he’s like really trying to get the ball out and mad he can’t. It’s same with laser pointers some cat experts think it’s not good because it’s a never ending thing with no satisfaction this toy to me sort of seems like the same thing the cat never wins. But it does keep him going and get some exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my disabled Foster Cat needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a disabled cat that I foster. She want to keep up with the others badly to play but just cant and most of the cat toys that are self managed require standing on their back legs and this is the one thing she can not do. She had a hip replacement and will need another surgery just to be able to walk correctly, but for now she needs to be able to play. This is perfect since it sits on the ground and when she pushes the balls they don't ho across the room for another cat to confiscate. My elderly cat also likes it.
customer_reviews.author: TNWorkNMom

customer_reviews.title: Catastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my energetic kitten. She absolutely loves this toy. It is one of her go to toys and I am happy I do not need to monitor her when she uses it. It is safe to leave out without worrying about her getting hurt. The product came with the safety bar on top as advertised. The only two downfalls of this are that it only comes in the highlighter orange color and that it is pretty light so it moves around a lot as my kitten plays with it. Neither of these are huge issues and I am happy my kitten has a toy that she loves to interact with.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Product needs more weight to it
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I’m giving 4 stars . See we have another toy that’s similar , the one you can get at walmart it only has 1 ball plus it comes with a scratcher in the middle. BIG difference between the two! Our cats love the other one which is what enticed me to by this one.... This one is very light weight , even the balls are. Sometimes they try to cuff a ball and the whole thing moves! The balls don’t moves so well cause of the craftsmanship. If this was made with some weight to it, it would be a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Moody

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last week and the cat is driving us nuts. She plays with it all day long. She sits on it, she lays on it, she pounces on it, she turns it over and tries to pull the balls out of the toy. If she's not doing all these things, she's sitting across the room from it and stares at it with her tail slowly swishing back and forth. I think she's trying to figure out how to 'kill' it. Best. Toy. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Absolutely Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if my 2 yr old cat would like this, but he plays with it regularly. He lies on his side and with one paw bats one of the balls in one direction, and then when it comes around, knocks it in the opposite direction. At the same time he does the same thing with his other paw to one of the other balls. How he figured out how to do this, I haven't a clue, but he gets hours of fun out of it every day. It looks like fun, and despite the "Captain Queeg" aspects, I'm tempted to get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Read4Life

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it if you have a playful cat
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten absolutely loves this! It’s not the most expensive quality, but assuming no one steps on it or drops it on hard floor I think it will last plenty of time, it’s just not indestructible by any means, which is fine given the price and what it’s being used for. Our kitten loves anything with balls or rolling toys and for the price we couldn’t beat this. She literally just lies on the floor playing with this for 20 minutes straight, well worth the small costs
customer_reviews.author: Ale Ana

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat definitely loves this toy, and it's been going on 7 months now. As with all things, she does get bored with it, so I try to rotate it with several other toys and when I bring it out she acts like it's brand spanking new and she's never witnessed such an incredible thing ever. Only downside is that the whole thing can go skittering around the floor (hardwood) so I've had to put a bit of no-slip drawer liner under it so she doesn't send it careening around the place. It's worth it to see her having such a blast.
customer_reviews.author: TuesdaysGirl

customer_reviews.title: GREAT buy for my two 5 month old kittens
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this ! I have two 5 month Old kittens and they can entertain theirselves for hours with this . They can’t stand they can’t get the balls out of it lol. Very sturdy and so worth the price, especially with prime shipping . I’m sure I will have this for years to come for them to entertain themselves with . I love that it’s a toy with no strings , feathers , fabrics or stuffing . Very safe for them to play with and not worry about choking nor ingesting anything .
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Donohue

customer_reviews.title: Very fun to the cats, great low price, and now more safely made.
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar single-tier toy that the cats enjoy, and at this price it was surely worth a try to see if they might like this toy as well. They loved it right out of the box, and continue to play with it, many times multiple cats play with it at the same time. From other reviews, I gathered there may not be a "bar" across the top to prevent cats from sticking their heads in and potentially getting stuck, but these units did indeed have that bar (as seen in the picture, almost looking like a handle). Very happy with this purchase, my friends and family with cats will be getting these for the holidays for sure!
customer_reviews.author: D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The best toy I’ve gotten them
customer_reviews.text: My cats immediately started playing w this. ALL 3 played together on it immediately. They have never all played with a toy nicely together. Oooommmgg I’m so happy. And my little scaredy cat who hides WAYYY more than she plays LOVES it. This toy is amazing. How is it so much better for them than their other Chase a ball in a maze toys?! ❤️🙌🏼 Ok. They’ve had this toy for a grand total of 15 minutes, so hopefully it stands the test of time. But they’ve never been this keen on a toy and played together nicely and got my scaredy cat out of her shell.
customer_reviews.author: Sam I am (not)

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for cats
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd purchase of this item. Same brand. The first one was built better and had a hole in the middle. We could hide toys in it and the cats loved to pick them out. This newer one has a handle in the middle. Also, one of the balls gets stuck at a certain point where I think the space on the track is a little too small. Our 2 cats know to just touch it and keeps going. This is a good toy to play with your cat and to have them occupy themselves when alone. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: IVJ

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves the different levels. I love that it has little rubber grips on the bottom so that it doesn't scoot around the floor. The only thing that would have made it perfect was if it was a little bigger. If I paid more attention to the specs, I'm sure I would have been better prepared when it arrived. But my kitty plays with it and it keeps her attention well, so I will keep it and call it a success of a toy purchase! It didn't cost too much at all either, so we love it :)
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Greenley

customer_reviews.title: This toy didn't interest my cats.
customer_reviews.text: This cat toy is sturdy and well made, but my two cats, aged 4 and 5, have shown no interest whatsoever in it; even though I added more balls, and twirled the balls around, they've just ignored it since it arrived several weeks ago. I have given it to my daughter; I'm hoping maybe her cats will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, 1/3 price on Amazon versus Petco
customer_reviews.text: My kitten has not stopped enthusiastically playing with this since it came yesterday, except to sleep and eat. He is pretty hard to engage with any toys on a stick (I have feathers, leather strips, a boa-like feather, and a mouse that makes noises (that one he likes but is hard to use because my terrier goes INSANE when he hears it, my goldendoodle who has little to no prey drive could care less) so I’m pleasantly surprised that he is so happy with this! Also this exact toy/brand/everything is $30 at Petco so this is a really good deal for $10.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: It is unstable and is easily knocked over by cats
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected. It is unstable and is easily knocked over by cats. Cats were amused for about a day
customer_reviews.author: TracyG

customer_reviews.title: This is the Best Toy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have never experienced a cat toy so well-enjoyed. It's actually a great game, and you can play, too! Sweet Baby Jayne immediately started playing with it and has never tired of it. She was really addicted for the first couple of weeks and lay beside it, as though she was guarding it, when she wasn't interacting with it. She still plays with it every day, and sometimes I play with her. I was hoping to download the video of her first experience with it, but for some reason, none of my videos showed up in this download. It was amazing how quickly she caught on.
customer_reviews.author: Sassafrass

customer_reviews.title: Cats played with it for hours! 🐈
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend’s two cats (yes, I’m a godmother to 2 adorable godcats). They loved it and it kept entertained for hours! We laughed as we watched them the entire time. My only feedback: it’s a little small for bigger cats. Additionally the toy has a plastic bar across across the top that partially covers the hole to avoid their head getting stuck. One if the cats stuck his arm down the hole. I hope I don’t run into problems with his paw/arm getting stuck. Otherwise, so worth it. So far, soooo good!
customer_reviews.author: Love, Amira

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly best $10spent! My little kitty is full of energy and always getting into some trouble. I have bought him many toys but this one seems to be doing the trick. I literally just received it, and he has not stopped playing with it since I took it out of the box. It's also a bonus because he entertains himself and mommy has time to get some work done! ♥ it is a bight on the light side so if Tsuki gets to excited it moves around but hasn't tumbled over.
customer_reviews.author: Norms

customer_reviews.title: The cats go nuts for it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a house full of rescue cats, and have various ball related toys in the house all the time... the cats really enjoy them. I saw this tower, and honestly bought it because it was so cheap. I figured hey, someone might have some fun with it. I never imagined how much they'd enjoy this thing! Someone (usually several someones) is always messing with it. I move it around the house periodically, and it's suddenly brand new again... they love the heck out of it! Definitely one of my best cat buys for the price ever.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: My Two Kittens Love It
customer_reviews.text: I have two 8 month old kittens, saw this item, reviews were very good, so bought it. Can't tell you how many times in a day my kittens, one or both, are over batting the balls around. I have to admit I bought the balls that light up when they're hit (from a reviewer suggestion, so definitely pays to read through the reviews). I've had this for about a month now and it remains one of their main toys to play with. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: neat toy, if they like it
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd bought something like this when my cats had still been kittens, maybe they would've played with it more at that time. My cats like it, but they play with it very little as if it's not enough to entertain them at this point. They are middle-aged fur balls and will only play with this from time to time. I think it would've appealed to them more when they were little. Nothing against the toy itself, I think its just my cats and what keeps their attention at this point. Well made and requires no assembly or set up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, hours of entertainment for Kitty
customer_reviews.text: My cat is rather picky when it comes to toys (cat is a rescue, of older age, doesn't "understand" concept of toys), I'm very happy kitty liked this particular toy, provides hours of entertainment for her. I do wish it was a bit bigger (she is in the exact size of this item's description/recommendation for cat size, and I feel it's a bit small for her), I will most likely get her a bigger model,but this is an AMAZING starter item if you're not sure if your cat is going to like this type of toy.
customer_reviews.author: Al co

customer_reviews.title: too simple for my clan...
customer_reviews.text: Two cat household. One could not care less about this toy....one pushed the balls about for about three minutes, determined that they weren't coming out and never touched it again... Love the puzzle toy boxes and mazes....this just became clutter. Sorry, it is well made and well thought out...the rescue home we gave it too says it is quite popular with their inmates
customer_reviews.author: Don Lj Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Even Seniors Love It
customer_reviews.text: My indoor/outdoor cat is almost 16 and around 10 pounds. When she's inside, we provide her with toys to keep her mind sharp. Who would have thought something so simple would be so fun for her? She has a tower of tracks (basically 3 of these on top of each other) that she loves, but she loves this one just as much - if not more! We haven't had the issue of the ball popping out like others mentioned... maybe because she's a senior she isn't as rough and just likes to swat at it. Regardless, I'd highly recommend even for older kitties.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Entertianment
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy. My new young cat plays with it all day long and my senior citizen cat plays with it when she can. She's more into laying around watching the birds these days. My new cat can't walk by it without playing. There are 3 tiers with 3 different balls and it's fun and colorful. I think this is a great deal for the money. I do believe cats need entertainment on a daily basis just as we do to prevent boredom. This toy provides that.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Great Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: We are cat-sitting our daughter's cat. She needed toys to play with after she finished terrorizing the dogs. I ordered three toys on Amazon. Out of the three, this is her favorite. She can spin those balls around for 30 minutes at a time. It is fun watching her play. She loves the other two toys too. I hit a home run with what I bought. Rainbow Cat Dancer, and Hot Bee Electric Moving Fish. Total $28. Money well spent on these toys.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: All Cats Need This!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE this interactive toy! The video shows my 12 year old kitty, Casper, enjoying it all by himself! He and my other cat, Woody, get on opposite sides and bat the balls to each other! Casper has some medical issues and is usually laid back, but this new toy makes him feel like a kitten again! This is an excellent product for the money. I will definitely buy another one for my boarder kitties! 🙀🙀🐾🐾❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: Furball

customer_reviews.title: 1/4 the price of a retail pet shop! CATS LOVE IT! GREAT HEIGHT & SIZE! Great for Parrots too!
customer_reviews.text: 1/4 the price of a retail pet shop! Very nice! Durable. Cat's mainly play with the top ball on the top ring as it is easier to reach, but that is OKAY because the bottom is hard to reach for cats, thus those (single) on the floor one giant ring only are a struggle for cats. This is the PERFECT SIZE & HEIGHT for ALL CATS! If the cats bat the ball slowly, it will come back easier than that single giant one that sits on the floor. Seems unbreakable, unless you plan to give it to a cougar. Great for Large parrots too!
customer_reviews.author: Schnitzel

product_meta.title: Petstages Cat Tracks Cat Toy - Fun Levels of Interactive Play - Circle Track with Moving Balls Satisfies Kitty’s Hunting, Chasing & Exercising Needs
product_meta.description:
Style:Tower of Tracks

Tower of Tracks Cat Toy

With 3 levels for 3 times the fun, Tower of Tracks multi-tier kitty ball track features colorful moving balls which are irresistible to pets. A cool way to attract your cat’s paws and claws away from your furniture, the batting and chasing puzzle play toy provides endless active fun for cats and kittens as they move and control the spinning balls.

Strong and sturdy enough for vigorous play, each of the 3 levels contains its own durable ball within a closed circle track, and the our puzzle’s non-slip base prevents unwanted movement. Designed to satisfy your cat’s hunting instincts, the ball and track cat toy is a simple way to make sure indoor cats get plenty of active exercise. Get your kitty interested by spinning the moving balls for interactive pet and owner playtime.

Voted one of the best interactive cat toys of 2018 by heavy.com, Tower of Tracks is a must have toy for cat lovers everywhere.
feature_bullets: BALLS SPIN & ROLL: This addictive, interactive cat toy is designed with 3 levels of tracks and 3 brightly colored moving balls to attract kitty’s attention!
3 TIER TOWER: With a stacked and sturdy construction, this multi-level circle track cat toy is durably built with a closed top and non-slip base to hold the cat track and ball toy in place.
BAT AND CHASE: Perfect for one or more cats, the interactive Tower of Tracks cat toy stimulates kitties’ senses and satisfies hunting instincts with an exciting moving puzzle.
INTERACTIVE FUN: Ideal for play, the cat ball track is also a great way to bond with your kitten – spin the balls to get them moving, then bat them to your cat!
MENTAL & PHYSICAL FUN: Get your kitty active! This indoor interactive cat track toy is a great way to help your cat get active with much needed daily exercise and excitement.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
